title: Lynx trade for Carrington, 2024's Most Improved
content: The Lynx have traded for Wings guard DiJonai Carrington, as the top team in the WNBA this season acquired last year's Most Improved Player.

title: Rhodes gets bank-shot hole-in-one at Open
content: Mimi Rhodes made a hole-in-one at the Women's Open Championship after her ball glanced off the ball of Stephanie Kyriacou, who had her own ace Friday.

title: Jerry Jones not swayed by Parsons' trade request
content: Cowboys owner and general manager Jerry Jones says he will not consider trading Micah Parsons after the star pass rusher posted on social media that he wants to leave the team.

title: U.S. women set 4x100 medley relay WR at worlds
content: The U.S. women's 4x100 medley relay team of Gretchen Walsh, Regan Smith, Kate Douglas and Torri Huske set a world record at the swimming world championships.

title: WNBA: Fan arrested for throwing sex toy on court
content: The fan who threw a sex toy on the court during a Valkyries-Dream game this week was arrested, the WNBA said, adding that throwing objects on the court will earn an ejection and ban moving forward.

title: Braves-Reds showcase at Bristol stalled by rain
content: MLB's long-planned event at Bristol Motor Speedway met an unwelcome detour, when rain suspended the Braves-Reds game until Sunday.

title: Lillard returning to Weber State, this time as GM
content: Damian Lillard is returning to college, this time as general manager of Weber State, where he once starred.

title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: Do Not Draft list: McCaffrey, Andrews among players being overvalued
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in fantasy football drafts.

title: How Bijan Robinson and Christian McCaffrey are forming a competitive bond
content: Along with Luke McCaffrey, the players shared tips about performance and recovery, during offseason workouts.

title: NBA fact or fiction: Was Draymond right about the end of free agency?
content: Did the CBA ruin NBA free agency? Bobby Marks plays "fact or fiction" with some of the offseason's most impactful trends.

title: Who makes the Year 2 leap? The top 10 sophomores to watch for the 2025-26 season
content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

title: Ruben Amorim Q&A: 'It's Manchester United; we need to return to Europe'
content: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim talks to ESPN about changing the club's culture, Alejandro Garnacho's future, and exchanging GIFs with Sir Jim Ratcliffe.

title: Arsenal's preseason Asia tour in review
content: Arsenal's preseason tour featured the arrival of a new star striker and the emergence of a bright prospect.

title: Transfer rumors, news: AC Milan to move for Liverpool's N√∫√±ez
content: AC Milan are looking to sign Liverpool striker Darwin N√∫√±ez. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Arsenal still open to Eze deal
content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could get done?

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: ‚öæ MLB trade grades: Report cards for biggest deals
content: How did you team fare as a flurry of deals came down to the wire? Here's our scorecard for all the big moves.

title: üò° Sources: Harper cussed out Manfred in meeting
content: Bryce Harper told MLB commissioner Rob Manfred to "get the f--- out of our clubhouse" during a meeting with the Phillies about the game's economics, sources told ESPN.

title: üèà Source: Teammate offended by Wilkins' kiss
content: Christian Wilkins, who was released by the Raiders on Thursday, kissed a fellow player on the head and the teammate took offense to it, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Barnwell's NFL trade tiers for all 32 teams
content: This exhaustive NFL trade guide factors in ability, positional value, contracts and age to figure out which players are really worth a first-round pick.

title: üèà Deion says he's cancer-free after surgery
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders said he recently had surgery to remove his bladder after doctors found a tumor there, and he declared that he has been cancer-free since the operation.

title: üèÄ Grading every NBA team's offseason
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by?

title: The Terry McLaurin trade request, explained: Why it could linger, and which teams should be interested
content: The Commanders' star wide receiver wants a new extension -- or a new team.  Can they justify paying him? And what could they get if they dealt him?

title: Solak's annual ranking of all 32 NFL coaching staffs: A new No. 1 and No. 32 ahead of the season
content: We used past performance, future expectations, in-game decision-making and more to rank coaching staffs.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands post-trade deadline
content: There was a lot of action across baseball ahead of Thursday's trade deadline. How did the moves impact each club's standing?

title: 'Some coaches have no idea': The uncertainties of recruiting in the new rev-share era
content: The uncertainty surrounding how programs will pay players is directly affecting the timeline for high school prospects.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: India ignores Trump threat: No order to refiners to stop buying Russian oil, claims report
content: Despite US pressure and potential penalties, India has not directed its oil refiners to halt Russian crude purchases, prioritizing energy security and diplomatic ties. Refiners continue sourcing oil based on commercial factors, even as contingency plans for alternative sources are explored.

title: Tejashwi's dual voter ID row: EC issues notice to RJD leader, asks him to hand over EPIC card
content: The Election Commission has issued a notice to RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav regarding discrepancies in his EPIC numbers. The ECI clarified that one of the EPIC numbers Yadav mentioned doesn't officially exist, requesting further details for investigation. This action follows Yadav's allegations of his name missing from the electoral rolls, which the ECI refuted, stating his name is indeed listed and accusing him of making false claims.

title: 'Misleading, baseless': EC fact-checks Chidambaram's migrant voters claim
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has refuted Congress MP P Chidambaram's claims regarding voter shifts and migrant inclusion in Tamil Nadu, labeling them as misleading and baseless. The EC clarified that the SIR exercise hasn't been rolled out in Tamil Nadu yet, making the connection to Bihar's voter list absurd. Chidambaram had questioned the addition of 6.

title: 'I'm going to propose to you': WCL owner's Live TV act leaves presenter stunned
content: South Africa Champions secured a dominant nine-wicket victory over Pakistan Champions in the World Championship of Legends final, propelled by AB de Villiers' stunning century. Off the field, league owner Harshit Tomar proposed to presenter Karishma Kotak live on air, creating a viral moment.

title: Bill Gates: AI today can replace human work; but it is not ‚Ä¶
content: Bill Gates believes AI is rapidly advancing, capable of handling simple coding tasks but not yet the most complex ones. Experts disagree on whether AI will master complex coding within two years or a decade. Gates highlights AI's potential to replace telesales jobs, impacting various sectors.

title: Watch: Thousands of Palestine supporters 'March for Humanity' in Sydney
content: Thousands of pro-Palestine supporters rallied in Sydney. They marched across the Harbour Bridge. The protesters demanded more aid for Gaza. They also sought sanctions against Israel. The demonstration followed government signals of potential recognition of a Palestinian state. Organizers accused Israel of genocide. The protest highlighted calls for a ceasefire and unrestricted humanitarian assistance.

title: TMC accuses Delhi Police of insulting Bangla; seeks Amit Shah's apology
content: Abhishek Banerjee, a senior Trinamool Congress leader, has strongly criticized the BJP after a Delhi police letter referred to Bengali as "Bangladeshi language." Banerjee condemned this as a deliberate insult and an attempt to undermine Bengali identity, accusing the BJP of systematically maligning Bengal and its culture.

title: 'What was he thinking?'- Ponting lambasts Siraj for costly fielding blunder
content: Ricky Ponting slammed Mohammed Siraj for dropping Harry Brook's catch, which resulted in a six, during the crucial final hour of the morning session on Day 4. Brook's aggressive counterattack, drawing comparisons to Rishabh Pant, shifted the momentum back to England after India initially gained control by taking early wickets. The match witnessed a seesaw battle between the two teams.

title: Grow a Garden trading and cooking event update: Full guide and new features
content: Roblox's Grow a Garden has launched its Trading and Cooking Event Update, introducing a fully interactive cooking system and a new trading mechanism. Players can now prepare dishes using harvested crops and trade items more efficiently to unlock rare in-game rewards. The update also includes exclusive cosmetics and unique pets, enhancing the game‚Äôs farming-simulation experience.

title: Prisoner number 15528: How Prajwal Revanna spent his first night in jail
content: Prajwal Revanna, designated prisoner number 15528, faced a tearful first night in Bengaluru's prison after receiving a life sentence for raping a domestic worker. Emotionally overwhelmed, he broke down during a medical examination, informing staff of his high court challenge to the conviction.

title: Missing for days: 4 Indian-origin senior citizens killed in US car crash; were going to temple
content: An Indian-origin family of four, travelling from Buffalo to Pittsburgh, has gone missing, prompting a search operation. Asha, Kishore, Shailesh, and Gita Divan were headed to West Virginia after stopping at a Burger King in Erie, Pennsylvania. Their cell phones are unanswered since Tuesday, and they never checked into their pre-booked lodging.

title: IND vs ENG: 'I won't lose my wicket' - Akash Deep reveals pep-talk that charged him up
content: Akash Deep's resilient 66 as nightwatchman on Day 3 of the Oval Test significantly boosted India's position. His crucial century stand with Yashasvi Jaiswal stabilized the innings, contributing to India's 396 total. Akash revealed his overnight determination to contribute meaningfully, emphasizing his resolve not to carelessly lose his wicket in the 2nd innings.

title: Mark Zuckerberg meets 24-yr-old AI researcher who rejected Meta's $125m job offer
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI dominance led them to recruit 24-year-old Matt Deitke, initially offering $125 million, which he declined. Zuckerberg's personal intervention resulted in a revised $250 million package, including potential $100 million in the first year. Deitke, known for his work on Molmo and founding Vercept, is a highly sought-after AI talent.

title: 'Cong to reveal serious malpractices of ECI', says Venugopal; declares date
content: The Congress party has accused the Election Commission of India (ECI) of "bias" in the ongoing revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, alleging voter exclusion. Senior Congress leader KC Venugopal announced plans to reveal "serious malpractices" on August 5 in Bengaluru. The ECI released draft rolls for Bihar, inviting claims and objections, while opposition parties raised concerns about potential voter deletion.

title: Travis Kelce‚Äôs family mourns death of Ed Kelce‚Äôs partner at 74
content: Ed Kelce, father of NFL stars Travis and Jason Kelce, announced the passing of his partner, Maureen Maguire, on August 1, 2025, at the age of 74. Maguire, who grew to love football, often accompanied Ed to games and events. She famously joked with Taylor Swift about her relationship with Ed.

title: Chennai shocker: Man beheads wife over suspected infidelity
content: A CRPF constable, Tamil Selvan, was arrested in Chennai for beheading his wife in Tuticorin district due to suspicions of infidelity. After murdering Uma Maheshwari, he surrendered his children to his father-in-law and fled. Seeking to publicly discuss the crime, he approached a news channel, whose staff alerted the police, leading to his capture.

title: IND vs ENG : Mohammed Siraj's bizarre blunder leaves Prasidh Krishna red-faced
content: Harry Brook's aggressive batting put India under pressure in the ongoing Test match. Prasidh Krishna's celebration was cut short when Mohammed Siraj inadvertently crossed the boundary rope while taking a catch. Brook got six runs instead of being dismissed. The incident highlighted the match's dramatic shifts as England aims to win the series, while India fights to level it.

title: ‚ÄòTrains communists ...': Report accuses Harvard of having ties with CCP
content: Harvard University faces scrutiny over its decade-long partnerships with organizations linked to the Chinese Communist Party. A congressional probe revealed collaborations with entities like the Central Organisation Department and the Chinese Executive Leadership Academy Pudong. Concerns are mounting about potential foreign influence and national security risks, especially regarding the training of Chinese officials.

title: ‚ÄòJaws broken, spine fractured‚Äô: SpiceJet staff assaulted by army official; airline responds
content: In Srinagar Airport on July 26, 2025, a senior Army official allegedly assaulted four SpiceJet employees after being asked to pay for excess baggage. The airline reports severe injuries to its staff, including spinal fractures and jaw injuries, resulting from punches, kicks, and use of a queue stand.

title: Morkel‚Äôs words, Siraj‚Äôs action ‚Äì Pope falls right after boundary discussion
content: Mohammed Siraj's relentless efforts at The Oval are proving fruitful, highlighted by the crucial dismissal of Ollie Pope with a sharp nip-backer. Siraj, now the leading wicket-taker in the series with 20 wickets, previously removed Zak Crawley with a searing yorker. England, chasing 260, are currently at 114 for 3, with India maintaining a strong position.

title: Watch: Drunk man drives car onto Meerut railway platform, narrowly misses train; arrested
content: An intoxicated Army personnel, Sandeep Daka, drove his car onto the platform of Meerut Cantt railway station in Uttar Pradesh, narrowly missing a moving train. The Government Railway Police arrested Daka, seized his vehicle, and booked him under several sections of the Railway and Police Acts.

title: 'Alarming, illegal': Chidambaram slams EC over voter addition in TN, deletion in Bihar
content: P. Chidambaram criticized the election commission of India for adding approximately 6.5 lakh "migrant workers" to Tamil Nadu's electoral roll while removing around 65 lakh people from Bihar's voter list, terming them "permanently migrated." He questioned the ECI's methodology and described the move as an abuse of power, advocating for political and legal challenges against it.

title: IND vs ENG: Heated exchange between Yashasvi Jaiswal and Ben Duckett
content: Tensions flared at The Oval as India pressed for a series-levelling victory, with Jaiswal and Duckett exchanging words on the field. India's aggressive approach, both with their bowling and verbal pressure, intensified England's chase of 374. Jaiswal's century and crucial fifties from Akash Deep, Jadeja, and Sundar propelled India to a strong position, setting up a compelling Day 4.

title: IND vs ENG: ‚ÄòNailed the trap‚Äô: How Prasidh Krishna outfoxed Ben Duckett
content: Prasidh Krishna's strategic bowling led to the crucial dismissal of Ben Duckett on Day 4, ending a frustrating partnership. After a series of short deliveries, Krishna tempted Duckett with a fuller ball, resulting in an edge caught by KL Rahul. This breakthrough fueled India's belief in leveling the series, marking a significant moment after sustained pressure and tactical planning.

title: 'Saiyaara' holds strong at box office; beats 'Dhadak 2', trails 'Son of sardar 2'
content: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's 'Saiyaara' continues its successful run, nearing the Rs. 300 crore milestone despite competition from new releases like 'Son Of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2.' While 'Son Of Sardaar 2' shows impressive box office numbers, 'Saiyaara' maintains a steady pace, showcasing its strong performance in its third week, driven by positive audience reception.

title: WCL Final | 'Still better than most playing in IPL' - Steyn on De Villiers
content: Dale Steyn believes AB de Villiers remains a top-tier player, even surpassing many current IPL internationals. This statement follows de Villiers' spectacular performance in the World Championship of Legends (WCL) 2025 final, where his unbeaten 120 off 60 balls led South Africa Champions to a dominant victory over Pakistan Champions.

title: 'He had two EPIC nos': BJP on Tejashwi's 'missing name' claim; asks did he have 2 voter IDs?
content: The BJP has accused RJD of electoral roll tampering in Bihar, alleging RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav possesses multiple voter IDs. This accusation follows Yadav's claim that his name was missing from the voter list, which the Election Commission refuted, confirming his name's presence.

title: 'Gautam Gambhir should get his bowlers and show ... ' - Ravi Shastri's stern message for India
content: As India pushes for a series-levelling victory against England at The Oval, former coach Ravi Shastri advised Indian bowlers to target specific dents on the pitch for maximum impact. Shastri highlighted the increased grass cover compared to earlier matches, making conditions challenging for England. Mel Jones noted the unpredictable bounce caused by the surface.

title: UP accident: 11 devotees killed as SUV plunges into canal; CM announces Rs 5L aid
content: A tragic accident in Gonda district claimed the lives of 11 devotees from Seha village. Their SUV plunged into a canal near Belwa Bahuta while en route to the Prithvinath temple in Ayodhya for Jalabhishek. Four pilgrims were rescued.

title: 'I was a baby' ‚Äì Gavaskar declares Gill‚Äôs 754 more valuable than his 774 -Watch
content: Sunil Gavaskar lauded Shubman Gill's impressive 754 runs, acknowledging it surpassed his own achievements. Gavaskar presented Gill with a special shirt and autographed cap. The event followed Gill's tactical brilliance with Mohammed Siraj, dismissing Zak Crawley. Gavaskar also reminisced about his lucky jacket from the Gabba Test.

title: ‚ÄòHappen in Lagaan‚Ä¶‚Äô: Trump sees Pak selling oil to India! Reality of their reserves
content: Harsh Goenka mocked Donald Trump's suggestion of Pakistan selling oil to India, deeming it highly improbable. Trump claimed a deal with Pakistan to develop its 'massive' oil reserves, potentially leading to sales to India. However, Pakistan's proven reserves are significantly smaller than India's, and it heavily relies on oil imports, making Trump's scenario unlikely.

title: 'For my mom and dad' - Emotional Jaiswal on scoring century in front of parents | Watch
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's resilient 118 in the second innings at The Oval propelled India to a total of 396 against England. The emotional knock, his second century of the series, was witnessed by his parents for the first time. Jaiswal expressed gratitude for performing in front of them, marking the moment with a celebratory gesture.

title: Granite quarry collapse: 6 workers dead, 10 injured in Andhra; rescue ops on
content: A devastating rockslide at a granite quarry in Bapatla district claimed the lives of six workers and left ten others seriously injured. The incident occurred at the Satyakrishna Granite Quarry near Ballikurava, trapping workers under a collapsed portion of rocks. Rescue operations are underway to recover the remaining bodies, while the injured receive treatment at Narasaraopet Government Hospital.

title: Himachal monsoon havoc: 173 dead, highways shut; IMD warns of more rainfall
content: Himachal Pradesh is reeling from relentless rain, resulting in blocked roads, power outages, and disrupted water supplies, with Chamba, Kullu, Mandi, and Una being the worst-hit districts. The monsoon season has claimed 173 lives, with a significant number attributed to landslides and flash floods.

title: Meet Arvinder Singh Bahal: 80-yr-old space tourist on Blue Origin flight; launching August 3
content: Agra's 80-year-old Arvinder Singh Bahal, a seasoned traveler, is set to embark on Blue Origin's New Shepard NS-34 mission on August 3, 2025. Having explored all 196 countries, Bahal's space journey symbolizes his lifelong curiosity. Blue Origin's suborbital flight will take Bahal and other passengers beyond Earth's atmosphere from West Texas.

title: Vaughan slams Pietersen: 'He‚Äôs talking nonsense' - all you need to know
content: A social media clash erupted after Kevin Pietersen claimed Test batting was tougher 20 years ago, listing legendary bowlers and challenging fans to name modern equivalents. Michael Vaughan countered, asserting current bowlers are equally skilled. He highlighted India's seamers, Australia's trio, and South Africa's Rabada and Jansen, praising the competitiveness of recent Test cricket and the quality of today's bowlers.

title: 'Let departed rest in peace': BJP fumes over Rahul's Jaitley 'threatened' him claim
content: Rahul Gandhi's claim that Arun Jaitley threatened him over farm laws has sparked controversy, drawing strong condemnation from BJP leaders and Jaitley's son, Rohan. They refuted the claim, citing Jaitley's death in 2019, before the laws were introduced. Critics accuse Gandhi of making baseless allegations and disrespecting the deceased leader.

title: Watch: Sundar Pichai gets taste of something new during IND vs ENG 5th Test
content: During the fifth Test between India and England, Google CEO Sundar Pichai surprised fans by joining the commentary box alongside Harsha Bhogle. Pichai shared his childhood cricket memories and admiration for Gavaskar and Sachin. Coincidentally, Washington Sundar's counterattack coincided with Pichai's commentary, adding a delightful twist to the day's events. He also predicted a 2-2 series tie.

title: Happy Friendship Day 2025: Best Messages, quotes, wishes, greetings card to share on Friendship Day
content: Friendship Day 2025 is approaching, offering a chance to strengthen bonds with cherished friends. The day encourages reconnecting with old acquaintances, expressing gratitude to current companions, and celebrating meaningful relationships through heartfelt gestures. From sharing nostalgic photos to planning themed parties or virtual meetups, the focus remains on appreciating the invaluable role friends play in life's journey.

title: Watch: 41-yo ABD flaunts his 'aura' in viral celebration after WCL 2025 title
content: AB de Villiers, at 41, showcased his enduring brilliance by scoring a match-winning century in the World Championship of Legends final, leading South Africa Champions to victory over Pakistan Champions. Following the win, de Villiers joined Wayne Parnell in recreating the viral "aura farming" dance, delighting fans.

title: Guns, Jeans, and Republican: How Sydney Sweeney became MAGA's new muse
content: In an era where even a sneeze can be interpreted as a political statement, Sydney Sweeney has become the conservative darling of the year‚Äîwithout attending a single rally or issuing a single press release. The star of Euphoria and The White Lotus has, quite by accident, become a MAGA icon. All it took was a leaked Republican voter registration, a denim ad campaign misread as a white supremacist dog whistle, and a shooting range video that could‚Äôve doubled as NRA propaganda. Welcome to 2025, where political identity is crafted less by what you say, and more by which side claims you.

title: Video: Army Officer's "Murderous Assault" Of SpiceJet Staff Over Luggage
content: An army officer has been charged for a "murderous assault" over excess cabin luggage at Srinagar airport that left four SpiceJet employees with "grievous injuries," including a spinal fracture, the airline has said.

title: "Voter ID Showed By You Does Not Exist": Poll Body Notice To Tejashwi Yadav
content: The Election Commission -- which has refuted Tejashwi Yadav's claim that his name is not in the voter list -- has now asked him to provide details of the voter ID card he had showed at a press conference yesterday to back his claim.

title: Man Arrested For Sending Hoax Bomb Threat To Nitin Gadkari's Nagpur House
content: Police on Sunday arrested a man for issuing a bomb threat to Union minister Nitin Gadkari's residence in Nagpur, which later turned out to be a hoax, officials said.

title: IED Blast Kills Railway Personnel In Odisha-Jharkhand border, Maoists Role Suspected
content: A railway personnel was killed in an IED blast on a railway track near Odisha-Jharkhand border in Sundergarh district on Sunday, police said.

title: "False Figures Being Floated": Poll Body on P Chidambaram's Big Voter List Claim
content: "False figures being floated about enrolment of 6.5 lakh voters in Tamil Nadu": Poll body on P Chidambaram's big claim

title: Assam Man Found Dead, Wife And Daughter Plotted Murder, Gave Robbery Angle
content: A businessman was allegedly killed by his wife and teenage daughter in Assam's Dibrugarh. The case has shocked their neighbours in the district's Barbaruah neighbourhood.

title: "Lilliput": K Kavitha's Insult To Party Leader Heralds Next Row In BRS
content: BRS MLC Kalvakuntla Kavitha made a shocking claim today that powerful members of her own party were responsible for inappropriate personal comments made against her recently by MLC Chintapandu Naveen, popularly known as Teenmaar Mallana.

title: Video: Truck Gets Stuck In Pothole After Part Of Delhi Road Caves In
content: A truck sank into the ground at Central Delhi's Nabi Karim area following continuous rainfall in the capital. Fortunately, no casualties or injuries were reported in the incident.

title: NASA Astronaut Back In Orbit 20 Years After Bihu Dance On International Space Station
content: NASA astronaut Mike Fincke is currently aboard the International Space Station (ISS) as part of the newly launched SpaceX Crew-11 mission.

title: US Tightens Green Card Rules For Married Couples
content: If a US citizen sponsors a foreign spouse, the couple must now submit strong evidence of a real relationship like joint financial records, photos, and letters from friends or family.

title: Kerala Panchayat Booked For Allegedly Killing Hundreds Of Stray Dogs
content: An animal rights activist from the Idukki-based animal rescue team filed a complaint against the Munnar panchayat authorities, alleging they had recently culled hundreds of stray dogs.

title: Gururgam Man Leaves Home With Rs 7 Lakh, Stabbed Hours Later By Live-In Partner
content: A woman in Gurugram stabbed her live-in partner as a days-long dispute allegedly over him meeting his wife and children continued to escalate. He died during treatment.

title: "It Rains Heavily Whenever Chief Minister Prays To Lord Krishna": BJP Minister On Rajasthan Floods
content: Addressing a question on waterlogging in Barmer district, Rajasthan minister K K Vishnoi said that every time the CM offers prayers to Lord Krishna, it rains so heavily that he is compelled to request Lord Indra to slow it down.

title: New Zealand Woman Arrested After 2-Year-Old Found Trapped In Her Suitcase
content: A New Zealand woman was arrested on Sunday after travelling on a bus with a two-year-old girl trapped in her luggage.

title: Video: Influencer's Lamborghini Worth Rs 10 Crore Catches Fire In Bengaluru
content: A Lamborghini Aventador sports car, which costs nearly Rs 10 crore, caught fire on a street in Bengaluru last evening. The sports car, it is learnt, belongs to social media influencer Sanjeev

title: Protest, Political Blame Game Over Quota For Backward Classes In Telangana
content: The political landscape in Telangana is currently dominated by a high-stakes standoff over the implementation of a 42 percent reservation for Backwards Classes (BC), leading to a series of protests.

title: "Was Coerced To Take PM Modi's Name": Pragya Thakur On Malegaon Case
content: In an explosive claim, former BJP MP Pragya Thakur has said investigators tried to coerce her into naming PM Narendra Modi, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat and others in connection with the Malegaon blasts case.

title: 2 Assam Teens Hit With Sticks, Punched By Mob Over Theft Suspicion. Video Viral
content: Two teens were brutally assaulted by a group of people over suspicion of theft in Assam's Golaghat district.

title: BJP Slams Sharad Pawar's Party MLA For Anti-Sanatana Remarks
content: BJP MP Sambit Patra hit out at the Congress "ecosystem" for what he called its determination to defame Sanatan Dharma and use terms like "Hindu terror", citing the latest controversial statement by leader NCP-SP MLA Jitendra Awhad.

title: Jharkhand Education Minister Ramdas Soren Critical, On Life Support In Delhi
content: Jharkhand Education Minister Ramdas Soren, who is undergoing treatment at a private hospital here, continues to be critical, a source said on Sunday.

title: Annamayya police launch ‚ÄòOperation Trace‚Äô to unite missing girls with families
content: The campaign which commenced on August 1 will continue till month-end and a drive at railway stations, bus stands, religious places, and red-light areas will begin from August 11, says Superintendent of Police Vidyasagar Naidu

title: Sunnam Rajayya remembered on 5th death anniversary
content: Koyas observed the 5th¬†deah anniversary of three-time CPI(M) MLA of Bhadrachalam Assembly constituency at his native place in Sunnamvarigudem in Chintoor agency The three-time CPI(M) MLA of Bhadrachalam fought for the rights of Polavaram project displaced, tendu leaf collectors, and bamboo collectors in Godavari Valley

title: Scholars and seer spar over religion status demand at book release event in Bagalkot
content: The debate comes about during the release of the former Chief Minister Veerappa Moily‚Äôs book, Vishwa Samskara Mahayana Volume-3

title: Malegaon verdict ‚Äòslap on the faces‚Äô of those who used the term ‚Äòsaffron terror‚Äô, says Pragya Thakur
content: The former BJP MP reiterated her claims that, during her time in jail, she had been ‚Äòpressurised and tortured‚Äô into naming several senior political and social leaders, including PM Narendra Modi, who was the Chief Minister of Gujarat at the time

title: Civil Supplies CID books over 1,000 cases of smuggling of PDS items in seven months
content: As many as 127 vehicles used for smuggling have been confiscated and 1,179 persons arrested between January and July this year

title: Jagan and his party are facing identity crisis, says Andhra Pradesh Housing Minister Kolusu Parthasarathy¬†
content: The YSRCP president‚Äôs desperation to lower the NDA government‚Äôs image in the eyes of the public is evident from his unrestrained comments, says Parthasarathy

title: Farming under the shadow of guns in Manipur‚Äôs ‚Äòbuffer zone‚Äô
content: Residents of villages situated in and around Manipur‚Äôs ‚Äòbuffer zone‚Äô, a strip of militarised farmland separating the Meitei-dominated Imphal Valley from the surrounding hills inhabited by Kuki-Zo people, have faced difficulties in cultivating their fields after the ethnic conflict broke out between the two communities in May 2023, leading to severe losses. The farmers are seeking adequate protection, support, and compensation

title: All eyes on Cabinet‚Äôs decision on Justice Ghose Commission report on Kaleshwaram project¬†
content: Three-member committee of officials reportedly finalising summary of the report to be considered by the Cabinet¬†¬†

title: Helping self-help groups set up small industries under Atmanirbhar Bharat
content: The Yadgir Zilla Panchayat is organising awareness programmes to turn the purpose of the scheme into reality

title: Man assisting postmortem arrested for stealing gold ornaments from body of stampede victim
content: The accused had allegedly stolen the valuables from the deceased body. However, he lost them when he collapsed drunk on the road while returning home

title: Tensions escalate at Kerala University; Syndicate members accused of intimidation
content: Syndicate members G. Muralidharan and J.S. Shijukhan accused of attempting to impose unlawful directives to several employees including female employees

title: Urea shortage in Karnataka: There‚Äôs more to it than meets the eye
content: Variations in the demand-and-supply chain have caused problems earlier also, the worst being the police firing in Haveri in 2008, when protests over fertilizers turned violent ultimately resulting in the death of two farmers and a few being crippled for life

title: Abandoned fibre boats to be cleared for harbour extension works
content: Harbour Development Society to review the process with the support of the Fisheries department in Kozhikode district

title: Kochi bids adieu to M.K. Sanoo
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan and Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan paid their homage to the late writer

title: HAML reduces property impact in Metro Phase II Old City alignment
content: Compensation totalling ‚Çπ360 crore has already been disbursed to affected property owners and¬†awards have been issued for 412 properties and demolition of 380 has been completed

title: Thousands throng the banks of the Cauvery to celebrate Aadi Perukku
content: Amma Mandapam in Srirangam and several bathing ghats in the region were overcrowded with enthusiastic devotees from nearby villages celebrating the festival

title: ECI asks Tejashwi Yadav to hand over his EPIC card after his name was found on the draft poll roll under a different number
content: Mr. Yadav had claimed that his EPIC number, used to vote in the Lok Sabha election, was missing, but ECI finds his name under a different number; no party has filed claims and objections on draft roll yet, says ECI

title: Exasperated by frequent blackouts, Karaikal residents demand new substation
content: Several villages reel under the impact of frequent power outages in Thirunallar and Nedungadu commune whenever there is rain or strong wind

title: Dalai Lama lays foundation stone of new Chowkhang Vihara monastery in Ladakh
content: The temple, constructed in 1957, is up for reconstruction after developing cracks and other damage due to floods

title: Kerala Higher Education and Law Ministers hold talks with Governor on higher education crisis
content: Discussions held against the backdrop of a Supreme Court judgment that urges Governor and State government to work together in appointing regular Vice-Chancellors

title: Government looks to push legislative agenda amid parliamentary deadlock over SIR discussion demand
content: Except for a two-day discussion on the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor in both the Houses, parliamentary proceedings have been all but a washout since the Monsoon session began on July 21.

title: Three-tier mechanism for implementing floating solar projects in Kerala
content: Responsibilities such as identification of potential sites, creation of ‚Äòland banks,‚Äô providing clearances and approvals and monitoring the progress of projects will be shared among a high-level committee, an empowered committee and district-level committees

title: ED arrests ex-Axis MF fund manager in 'front-running' case
content: The ED has been investigating the matter under the civil provisions of the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA). The Income Tax Department had conducted searches in this case in 2022.

title: Teachers set to become first responders in snake encounters in Kerala‚Äôs schools
content: Forest department is set to launch a pilot programme in Palakkad district, which has consistently recorded some of the highest numbers of snake encounters in the State

title: ECI's neutrality questionable; Opposition wants discussion in Parliament: Gaurav Gogoi
content: The common people should know the status of their voting rights and details of polling stations. We want a discussion on this, but the government is saying they cannot discuss the matter, said Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi

title: PM Modi meets President Murmu in Rashtrapati Bhavan amid Bihar SIR stir in Parliament
content: The meeting also comes also came days after U.S. President Donald Trump announced 25% tariffs plus a penalty on exports from India

title: Attack on pastor: Sulthan Bathery police register suo motu case
content: The assault reportedly spearheaded by a group of Bajrang Dal activists took place at Cherukad in Wayanad district on April 2, 2025 alleging religious conversion attempts

title: In a village of silence, her violin continues to sing for 80 years
content: Born in 1934, Meenakshi Subramanian is probably one of the last musicians of her generation from the composite Thanjavur district to have remained confined to her village ‚Äî more precisely, within the four walls of her home ‚Äî whilst others migrated to Chennai.

title: People are happy with implementation of Talliki Vandanam scheme: Minister Kondapalli Srinivas
content: Along with Minister for Home V. Anitha, Kondapalli Srinivas inaugurated newly constructed primary school in Pusapatirega of Vizianagaram district on August 3

title: Dedicated gibbon conservation action plan sought in NE
content: Assam-based primatologist flags the threats to the western hoolock gibbon, India‚Äôs only ape species, at a convention of the International Primatological Society in Madagascar

title: Party ‚Äòinsiders‚Äô behind the unpalatable comments against me, says TRS MLC Kavitha
content: Kavitha said the government is yet to give permission on her BC dharna on August 4 but hoped that the High Court would protect her rights

title: Senior Bihar Congress leader Ashok Kumar joins JD(U)
content: The Congress party has no respect for Dalits, and the party has remained as only a B-team of the Rashtriya Janata Dal, alleged Ashok Kumar (Ram)

title: A total of 140 people of Nicobari tribe, PVTGs to join Andaman Police
content: ‚ÄúThe PVTGs will join as Home Guard Volunteers and their recruitment process was successfully concluded in a fair, transparent and meticulous manner recently,‚Äù an officer said

title: Working with rival groups dangerous: NSCN(I-M) on 10 years of peace pact
content: Accusing the Centre of going slow on the Framework Agreement under various pretexts, the outfit‚Äôs chairman Q. Tuccu said it is poles apart from the Agreed Position

title: Army officer attacks SpiceJet employees at Srinagar airport over excess baggage issue
content: The airline described it as a ‚Äòmurderous assault‚Äô on its staff and said they suffered spinal fracture and jaw injuries

title: Suvendu Adhikari claims 1 crore 'Rohingya, Bangladeshi, fake voters' present in Bengal, urges ECI to take action
content: SIR is a regular practice of the Election Commission of India. Even in the year 2002, the SIR exercise was carried out in West Bengal. Names of 20 lakh voters were removed from the voter list, says Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar

title: Two killed as SUV falls into gorge in J&K Kathua
content: All five passengers were en route to the campsite at Chanderkote along the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway when the accident occurred near Kainta Morh

title: U.P. CM Adityanath deploys Ministers across 12 flood-hit districts
content: The Chief Minister directed all Ministers in charge to immediately visit their assigned districts, inspect relief camps, and directly engage with affected families. He instructed senior officials‚Äîincluding DMs, SPs, and CMOs‚Äîto stay on the ground and ensure 24x7 monitoring.

title: Anti-terror operation in Jammu & Kashmir‚Äôs Kulgam enters third day
content: Two terrorists have been killed in the encounter which began on Friday after security forces launched a cordon and search operation in a forest area at Akhal in the south Kashmir district

title: More than 20 lakh Assam farmers get ‚Çπ422 crore under PM-KISAN scheme
content: The amount was disbursed as part of a nationwide programme, which was launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Varanasi,‚Äù a senior official of the Agriculture Department said

title: ‚ÄòSanatan Dharma has ruined India,‚Äô says NCP-SCP MLA Jitendra Awhad after Malegaon verdict
content: Sanatan Dharma has ruined India. There was never any religion called Sanatan Dharma. We are followers of Hindu Dharma. It was this so-called Sanatan Dharma that denied our Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj his coronation, says NCP-SCP MLA Jitendra Awhad

title: Kannur‚Äôs ‚Äòtwo-rupee doctor‚Äô A.K. Rairu Gopal passes away at 80; leaves behind legacy of compassion and service
content: For over 50 years, Dr. Rairu Gopal stood as a beacon of hope for the common people, charging just ‚Çπ2 for a consultation and often providing free medicine to those in financial distress

title: Unscientific mining pushing Uttarakhand's Bageshwar toward disasters: Govt panel to NGT
content: According to the report, most mines have altered natural slopes through steep vertical cuts and lack proper benches, making the terrain highly "vulnerable to landslides" and rockfalls.

title: Mother, two minor daughters beaten to death by miscreants in Samarlakota in Kakinada district
content: The Kakinada divisional police rushed to the spot and the bodies have been sent to Kakinada Government General Hospital for post-mortem

title: ‚ÄòStrong suspicion, no legal proof‚Äô: Why all 7 accused in 2008 Malegaon bomb blast case walked free
content: Special Judge A.K. Lahoti said that while it was proven that a bomb blast had taken place, the prosecution failed to present reliable evidence to prove that the seven accused were behind it

title: ECI‚Äôs SIR exercise is ‚Äòan insult to migrant workers and gross interference in right of electorate in Tamil Nadu‚Äô: Chidambaram
content: ‚ÄúIf the migrant worker‚Äôs family has a permanent home in Bihar and lives in Bihar, how can the migrant worker be considered as ‚Äòpermanently migrated‚Äô to Tamil Nadu?‚Äù asks Mr. Chidambaram

title: He has his reasons: Shashi Tharoor on Rahul Gandhi's 'dead economy' remark
content: The remarks came after Rahul Gandhi on July 31 agreed with Donald Trump‚Äôs statement that the Indian economy is ‚Äúdead‚Äù and said he is ‚Äúglad‚Äù that the US President has stated a fact

title: News In Frames | Konkan‚Äôs own derby

title: MNS workers vandalise dance bar in Navi Mumbai

title: 800 students from northeast visit ISRO facilities in Bengaluru
content: The visit is part of the North East Students‚Äô Programme for Awareness, Reach, and Knowledge on Space Programme

title: A new district flood severity index factors in flood impact on people
content: Researchers from IIT Delhi and IIT Gandhinagar have come up with a District Flood Severity Index (DFSI) that takes into account the mean duration in days of all flooding events in a district, percentage of area that is historically flooded, total number of deaths, number of people injured, and the population in the district

title: Woman‚Äôs mutilated body found in U.P.'s Bijnor
content: The police suspect the woman was attacked by a leopard, forest officials believe it to be a case of murder, with the body later mauled by an animal

title: Malegaon blast case: Key docs mysteriously vanished; original statements of witnesses lost
content: Armed with a degree in political science and law, Rebecca Samervel waltzed into journalism after a brief stint in modeling. As a reporter at The Times of India, Mumbai, she covers courts. She is a self-confessed food-a-holic. Travelling, politics and television are her passions. If you want to find her during the week the only place to look is the Bombay high court. title: What you missed from recruiting this summer
content: the busiest 60 days of the annual recruiting calendar are officially behind us . 155 prospects in the 2026 ESPN 300 made commitments in an avalanche of summer recruiting business from June 1 to July 31 . only 16 uncommitteds remain in the ESPN 300 as of Saturday morning .

title: How did the Cowboys and Parsons get here? Plus league reaction and what‚Äôs next

title: WWE SummerSlam Night 1 results: Seth Rollins cashes in on CM Punk, becomes new champion
content: CM Punk defeated Gunther to become the new WWE world heavyweight champion . he had won a gauntlet match last month on "Raw" to earn the right to challenge him . former members of the Bloodline, cousins Roman Reigns and Jey Uso team up .

title: MLB trade deadline winners and losers: What we loved -- and don't understand
content: this year's deadline didn't have star players on the move, like Juan Soto in 2022 . 68 trades on deadline day went down with a flurry of activity . the Astros traded closer Mason Miller to the Padres for leo de Vries .

title: CFP 2025: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff
content: the 12-team college football playoff will again include the five highest-ranked conference champions . there are 32 teams -- the most in the CFP era -- with at least a 10% chance of reaching the playoff . the list will shrink by November, but below it starts with 32 teams ranked in order of their percentage chance .

title: How Washington beat the odds -- and its past -- to return to RFK
content: Washington Commanders owner Josh Harris addressed reporters after striking one of the biggest deals in recent franchise history . Harris wore the expression of an athlete who had just won a big game . he grew up a fan of the team he bought from previous owner Dan Snyder for $6.05 billion in 2023 .

title: NYC gunman sought medical help before shooting
content: the gunman killed four people before taking his own life in a midtown Manhattan office building . he had sought medical help for frequent, debilitating headaches, a source says . the 27-year-old had regularly met with doctors, including a neurologist .

title: ‚öæ Making sense of the MLB trade deadline
content: the 2025 trade deadline is in the books . the San Diego Padres and Houston Astros made surprising moves that rocked the deadline . ESPN experts debate what's real moving forward . there's no team to beat in the American League, Bradford Doolittle says .
